name: Glamorization of the Old West Online Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Billy the Kid" dramatized the life of the gunman who started -and ended - young. Who starred in the movie?
questions.explanation:
Robert Taylor.

	Not a bad movie, nicely done by Taylor. Brian Donlevy as the good guy.Gene Lockhart as the villain.

questions.text: Victor Mature starred as which famous Indian leader?
questions.explanation:
Crazy Horse.

	All choices have been depicted in countless movies - usually as supporting characters and usually as villains. "Crazy Horse" had Mature in the title role with a different type of characterization.

questions.text: "They Died With Their Boots On" celebrates the life of the famous George Armstrong Custer. Who played him?
questions.explanation:
Errol Flynn.

	Why let the facts stand in the way of a good story? With Olivia DeHavilland (of course).

questions.text: Barbara Stanwyck starred as which of these famous women of the Old West?
questions.explanation:
Annie Oakley.

	An early starring role for Stanwyck cast her as the western sharpshooter.

questions.text: Tyrone Power starred as the legendary outlaw, "Jesse James". Who played his brother, Frank?
questions.explanation:
Henry Fonda.

	The others had their share of western starring roles. (Hudson starred in a movie about the life of outlaw John Wesley Hardin.) Was the real Jesse such a nice guy? Probably not.

questions.text: The sequel to "Jesse James" was "The Return of Frank James". Who played Frank's romantic interest?
questions.explanation:
Gene Tierney.

	Henry Fonda reprised his role as Frank. A young Gene Tierney played a would-be reporter.

questions.text: Who starred in "The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean"?
questions.explanation:
Paul Newman.

	Mid-career role for Newman as "the law west of the Pecos". Not that great a movie. Newman and Redford, of course, were Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. Douglas and Lancaster were Doc Holliday and Wyatt Earp, respectively, in "Gunfight at O.K. Corral".

questions.text: Charlton Heston starred in "Pony Express". Which famous character from the Old West did he portray?
questions.explanation:
Buffalo Bill.

	With Rhonda Fleming. Just using the name for the sake of the story, I guess.

questions.text: "My Darling Clementine" takes a look at the famous shootout at the O.K. Corral. Who played "Old Man" Clanton?
questions.explanation:
Walter Brennan.

	Henry Fonda and Victor Mature as Wyatt Earp and Doc Holliday. Bond played Morgan Earp. The always solid Brennan was Ike. Buchanan played the role in a TV series.

questions.text: John Wayne starred in "The Alamo". Which of the following was NOT in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Gregory Peck.

	John Wayne's less-than-successful epic version of the famous battle. Wayne played Davy Crockett. Widmark, Harvey and Boone rounded out the cast. Could have been better. Should have been better.
